space.arim.universal.util.collections

Class CollectionsUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • space.arim.universal.util.collections.CollectionsUtil

  • public final class CollectionsUtil
extends Object
    Utility class to apply operations to collections and arrays, as well as better unmodifiable collections support.

    Designed to reduce boilerplate operations.
    Author:
    A248

    • Method Detail

      • getFromMapRecursive

        public static <T> T getFromMapRecursive(Map<String,Object> map,
                                        String key,
                                        Class<T> type)
        Recursively retrieves a specified type of object from a Map of potentially nested maps.
        Periods delineate a nested map.
        This method is particularly useful for configuration loaded thorugh SnakeYAML.
        Specifically, if one must retrieve the yaml value key1.subkey.value as an Integer from the map configValues, one should call use getFromMapRecursive(configValues, "key1.subkey.value", Integer.class)
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type to retrieve. If the object found is not this type, null is returned
        Parameters:
        map - the map from which to retrieve recursively
        key - the key string
        type - the type class
        Returns:
        the object if found, null if not

      • wrapAll

        public static <T> T[] wrapAll(T[] original,
                              UnaryOperator<T> wrapper)
        Mutates the input array, setting each element to Function.apply(Object)
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the array
        Parameters:
        original - the input array
        wrapper - the UnaryOperator to wrap each element
        Returns:
        the mutated array where each element has been replaced with UnaryOperator.wrap(previous element)

      • checkForAnyMatches

        public static <T> boolean checkForAnyMatches(Collection<T> collection,
                                             Predicate<? super T> checker)
        Iterates across the collection, if Predicate.test(Object) for any element returns true, the method returns true. Otherwise, returns false.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the collection
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection across which to iterate
        checker - used when checking an element
        Returns:
        true if and only if checker.apply(element) returns true for any element

      • checkForAnyMatches

        public static <T> boolean checkForAnyMatches(T[] array,
                                             Predicate<? super T> checker)
        Same as checkForAnyMatches(Collection, Predicate) but accepts an array instead.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the array
        Parameters:
        array - the array across which to iterate
        checker - used when checking an element
        Returns:
        true if and only if checker.apply(element) returns true for any element

      • checkForAllMatches

        public static <T> boolean checkForAllMatches(Collection<T> collection,
                                             Predicate<? super T> checker)
        Iterates across the input array, if Predicate.test(Object) for any element returns false, the method returns false. Otherwise, returns true.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the collection
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection across which to iterate
        checker - used when checking an element
        Returns:
        true if and only if checker.apply(element) returns true for every element

      • checkForAllMatches

        public static <T> boolean checkForAllMatches(T[] array,
                                             Predicate<? super T> checker)
        Same as checkForAllMatches(Collection, Predicate) but accepts an array instead.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the array
        Parameters:
        array - the array across which to iterate
        checker - used when checking an element
        Returns:
        true if and only if checker.apply(element) returns true for every element

      • convertAllToString

        public static <T> String[] convertAllToString(T[] original)
        Converts an object array to a string array according to each object's Object.toString() method
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the array
        Parameters:
        original - the input array
        Returns:
        a string array

      • convertAll

        public static <T,R> R[] convertAll(T[] original,
                                   Function<T,R> mapper,
                                   R... doNotPassThisVariable)
        Converts an array of type T to type R according to the given mapping function.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the original array
        R - the type of the target array
        Parameters:
        original - the original array
        mapper - the mapping function
        doNotPassThisVariable - ignore this parameter and do not pass it. It is used for internal mechanics.
        Returns:
        a converted array
